import Theme from './Theme' import Photo from './Photo' import amplify from './images/amplify.png' const BlogArticle = () => { return (

Create a full-stack web application using AWS Amplify

{' '} In this post, I will introduce the features and implementations of this cloud space application, whose entire stack is built completely using AWS Amplify. Besides, I would also like to share with you a few problems I encountered when making this application, and hopefully this can save you some times googling around for the solutions.

The tutorial from AWS Amplify ofiicial website is a good starting point to learn and start building your own application. If you are also new to AWS Amplify like myself, I would highly recommend this tutorial series from{' '} Amazon

Prerequisites

Before start building your application using amplify, you need to ensure a few things installed on your system:

  • Node.js v10.x or later
  • npm v5.x or later
  • git v2.14.1 or later
  • AWS Amplify CLI
  • AWS IAM User

Set Up Front End

AWS Amplify supports most of the popular front-end framework in the market such as Angular, Vue. For this application, React was chosen to be used as the front-end framework, simply because I'm new to frontend development and I was always intersted in learning React. Feel free to use any framework you feel comfortable with.{' '}

Create a new react app with a CLI tool named 'create-react-app', and voila, your application front end is set up!

Initialze a new Backend

To set up the backend for your application, you first need to initialze Amplify on your project root with the command '$amplify init' .

) } export default BlogArticle
